title: What are some examples of kinesics nonverbal communication? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the world of communication, we interact with others through our 3 major senses - sight, sound, and touch (smell and taste are the lessor senses, rounding out the 5 senses). Kinesics (noun), or kinestethic (adjective) refers to the touch (including movement) category. Since your question is on nonverbals, not verbals, let me respond to that. Examples of nonverbal communication that express meaning without saying a word are numerous; a hug for affection, a pat on the back for comfort, a light touch on the arm or hand for instant connection, a handshake upon greeting, etc. Then there’s all the examples of self-placating and body movement that communicates much: a finger on the temple, rubbing of the chin, tugging of an ear, playing with one’s hair, itching one’s nose, steepling one’s fingers, clenching one’s hands into fists, biting one’s lip, swinging one’s leg, crossing one’s leg, etc, etc, etc. It’s a long list. Most important is not only noticing the nonverbals, but then understanding the communication signals that are conveyed. For example, what do different handshakes say about the other person entering into a meeting with you? What does your handshake say about your feelings towards the upcoming interaction? Are you happy? tenuous? nervous? withholding? insecure? hopeful? timid? When should you use a light touch on the arm, or better yet, on the hand (skin to skin)? What does it convey? Nonverbals make up the biggest part of communication, because they are hard to fake - the body automatically flashes the truth; words can lie. The science of body language is a fascinating look at the mechanics underneath the subconscious behavior that we all convey, intentionally and unintentionally, through our nonverbals.

You are in a group and talking to 1 of the guys/girls you touch their arm ( as if to say, I haven't finished, listen )You don't like somebody and you avoid turning in his directionYou try clear something away from his hair ( you feel close or want to be close)Opening your eyes wide and raising your eyebrows ( It's very unpleasant and shows the person doesn't want to give you a chance)Shaking or not shaking your hand when you meet ( if you don't do it, usually it shows that you are unwilling to have this person as friend) But, it could also be you don't like his sweaty hands.
